Message.Title: I will sell my entire position in ET if we go below 8 bucks
Message.Msg: I will sell my entire position in ET if we go below 8 bucks because a large part of it was purchased on margin. We all hope we will not see any 7.99 but 5K loss is better than a margin call and much higher loss. We should go up on a buyout news as usual anyway. imho

Message.Title: When most of us came up the American Dream was within reach
Message.Msg: If you had some talent and some drive, you could live the good life. Now, you need a lot of talent, a lot of drive and a lot of luck, and you probably will not have it as good as before. Diminished expectations are the Obama legacy.

Topic.Title: When most of us came up the American Dream was within reach

Message.Msg: Those were the days, my freind. We had it better than our parents. They had it better than their parents. America was looked up to. Now America is laughed at.

Topic.Title: When most of us came up the American Dream was within reach

Message.Msg: Obama is the master of malaise.

Topic.Title: I will sell my entire position in ET if we go below 8 bucks

Message.Msg: NO ONE is making an offer for this company. If they were then upper management wouldn't have been able to do that recent big buy. They'd have been in a quiet period. So if such a deal is in the works it would have had to be initiated sometime in the last two months, which means it'd still be almost too preliminary to even merit a rumor. And, the shock may well go down into the $7 range, in fact you should consider it a serious probability, at least for awhile. The game changes when the quarters earnings stop being burdened with special charges. It's worth holding, but always keep room in your reserves for it to drop fractionally before going back up. I'm long as well, but I'm long because of the long term potential of the company, not because of its short term "issues". I buy and sell around a permanent long position trading the swings between earnings reports once the trading range has been established. It's boring, REALLY boring, but you can make some money doing it.

Topic.Title: When most of us came up the American Dream was within reach

Message.Msg: Lettem laugh, Lettem laugh, Lettem laugh, as the last laugh will be on them. When they hit resource depletion we'll still have centuries of materials in our "protected" national parks and the vast explored interior of Alaska. Not to mention offshore petroleum reserves that because of excessive environmental regulation would have remained untapped. If I thought the environmentalists were so smart as to actually PLAN this aftereffect, I might have joined up with them, for as a national strategy exchanging a fiat currency for natural resources is a BIG win for the person who gets the natural resources.

Topic.Title: When most of us came up the American Dream was within reach

Message.Msg: **We had it better than our parents. They had it better than their parents** Those days are gone my friend. Look at the homebuilders they are now building houses with casita's(spanish for small house) to accomadate their children and parents moving back in with them. With the government barrowing $0.46 on every dollar spent and the minority population slated to become the majority you can say good by to the Great American Experiment. As the saying goes "when you borrow from Peter to pay Paul, you can always depend on Paul's support."

Message.Title: GOP incompetence
Message.Msg: Analysis of Flawed Right to Work Legislation Shows Governor, Republican Legislators, Had Never Reviewed Language Prior to Signing it Into Law Lansing – Less than 24 hours after Governor Snyder signed his damaging “Right to Work” legislation into law, analysis shows that the flawed legislation may not even have the result the Governor claimed it would, raising serious questions about whether the Republican leadership even read the language of the bills before voting it through and signing it into law. “It's become increasingly clear that the Governor presented the legislature with bills written by out-of-state extremists who had no understanding of Michigan's constitution or how our laws apply to Michigan workers,” said Senate Democratic Leader Gretchen Whitmer. “This is what happens when the Governor does an 11th hour about face in a lame duck session showing utter contempt for our people by cutting out all public input, scrutiny and debate. That isn't leadership, it's epic incompetence .” Reports today show that HB 4003, which the Governor said would provide “Right to Work” type policies for public employees in Michigan, could not be implemented as intended as the Michigan Constitution gives clear authority to the Civil Service Commission over conditions of employment for the state's workforce. Experts have suggested today only a vote of the Civil Service Commission could enact Right to Work policies for state workers. “The public was not given an opportunity to read these bills, legislators were not given an opportunity to read these bills, and we now know that the Governor himself either didn't read or didn't understand these bills himself,” said Senator Bert Johnson (D – Detroit). “This process has been a complete affront to Democracy from the start and was nothing more than a political gift to the Koch Brothers and ALEC who bought and paid for this legislation.” A series of questions have been raised in recent days over the legality of the “Right to Work” legislation as well as the process in which it passed. A lawsuit has already been filed against the Michigan House of Representatives for violating the Open Meetings Act as these bills were passed while the public was illegally locked out of the State Capitol and additional legal challenges are expected in the coming days.
